description: Memorable, quotable insights from industry experts and thought leaders

insights.title: Andre Karpathy on Agent Hype vs Reality
insights.content: Calling everything an agent creates unrealistic expectations and confusion. Fully autonomous AI still faces massive hurdles like data security. We're looking at the decade of agents, not the year.

supporting_data.claim: Quote from Andre Karpathy about agent timeline and expectations

insights.actionable_insight: Set realistic expectations for AI agent deployment and focus on workflow integration rather than full autonomy in the near term.

source.title: Top 6 AI Trends That Will Define 2026
source.author: Jeff Su

insights.title: AI Creates Unique Window Where Expertise is Being Reset
insights.content: Professor Ethan Mollick's research on the 'jagged frontier of AI' shows we're in a unique window where expertise is being reset. Because things are messy and undefined, there are no experts who know everything already - you just need to be willing to learn faster than the person next to you.

supporting_data.claim: Research on 'jagged frontier of AI' shows expertise is being reset in current window

insights.actionable_insight: Stop waiting for a perfect AI learning plan - start experimenting now while the playing field is still level and expertise advantages are being reshuffled.

source.title: Top 6 AI Trends That Will Define 2026
source.author: Jeff Su

insights.title: Small Teams with AI Have Infinite Leverage
insights.content: Small teams have infinite leverage now. A team of 5 to 10 people who share an incredible passion for a meaningful problem, armed with the technology we now have available, can probably do more in a three-year window than most people did in a 30-year career.

supporting_data.claim: Small AI-enabled teams can accomplish 30 years of work in 3 years

insights.actionable_insight: Consider forming or joining small, passionate teams focused on meaningful problems rather than large organizational structures.

source.title: AI Revolution: The Opportunity Window is Closing
source.author: Unknown

insights.title: Define Your Intent Well - The Key Skill of 2026
insights.content: If you can define your intent well enough, Claude Code now dressed up as Claude Co-work is able to do a good enough job that it will get it all the way done. And of course, that depends on your ability to define intent well, which is one of the key skills of 2026.

supporting_data.claim: Defining intent well is the key skill of 2026

insights.actionable_insight: Practice describing what you want in terms of outcomes, not steps. 'Prepare a summary of my week's client meetings with action items' not 'look at my calendar and write some notes.'
insights.relevance_reason: Teachable skill that helps SMB owners get better results from AI immediately
